t: On*p that day the Lord*s with his relentless, large, strong sword will bring judgment on Leviathan, the fleeing serpent - Leviathan, the twisting serpent. He will slay the monster that is in the sea.
On*pn that day sing*ln about a desirable vineyard:
I*ln am the Lord,*s who watches over it to*ln water it regularly. So*ln that no one disturbs it, I*ln watch over it night and day.
I*ln am not angry. If*ln only there were thorns and briers for me to battle, I*ln would trample them and*ln burn them to the ground.
Or*ln let it take hold of my strength; let*ln it make peace with me — make*ln peace with me.
In*ln days to come, Jacob will take root. Israel*ln will blossom and bloom and*ln fill the whole world with fruit.
Did*pn the Lord*s strike Israel as*ln he struck the one who struck Israel? Was*ln Israel killed like those killed by the Lord?*s
You*ln disputed with Israel by*ln banishing and driving her away. He*ln removed her with his severe storm on*ln the day of the east wind.

Therefore*ln Jacob’s iniquity will be atoned for in this way, and*ln the result of the removal of his sin will be this: when*ln he makes all the altar stones like*ln crushed bits of chalk, no*ln Asherah poles or incense altars will remain standing.
For*ln the fortified city will be desolate, pastures*ln deserted and abandoned like a wilderness. Calves*ln will graze there, and*ln there they will spread out and strip its branches.

When*ln its branches dry out, they will be broken off. Women*ln will come and make fires with them, for*ln they are not a people with understanding. Therefore*ln their Maker will not have compassion on them, and*ln their Creator will not be gracious to them.
On*pn that day the*ln Lord*s will thresh grain from the Euphrates River as*ln far as the Wadi of Egypt, and*ln you Israelites will be gathered one by one.

On*ln that day a*ln great ram’s horn will be blown, and*ln those lost in the land of Assyria will come, as*ln well as those dispersed in the land of Egypt; and*ln they will worship the Lord*s at*ln Jerusalem on the holy mountain.
